item.title: Pothole in centre of carriageway, 20th October
item.description:
Pothole repair failed again on carriageway towards Birdlip, previous fixes were applied on 6525353 and 6553455. This is, again, due to flooding issue not being resolved, despite flooding ticket closed, again, before being solved (6573696 and 6525362).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Blocked stream with overgrowth, 20th October
item.description:
The stream is severely blocked with long built up silt and vegetation growing along the entire length from the culvert (next to Lidl) all the way North running parallel with the Evesham Road (towards Homelands Estate) This is a serious hazard that will have an impact on flood management and is long overdue to be cleared and dredged. Several trees and large shrubs have grown in the soil and will need to be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Finlay Way, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large trench across the whole width of the road .deep .makes car suspension bash !, 20th October
item.description:
On hatherley road as you go up from roundabout near belworth drive towards town .its on both sides of road .its a trench and getting worse daily .please fix asap as urgent
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 79, Hatherley Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Totally blocked drain, 20th October
item.description:
Drain on Bath Parade at junction of St Lukes Place is totally blocked. When it rains very heavily all water from Bath Parade pours down St Lukes Place. Earlier today there was a river outside my house. During the storm of Friday 20 Sept the houses at the bottom of St Lukes Place almost flooded.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, St Luke's Place, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Utility company repair failing, 20th October
item.description:
BT (I believe) recently dug a hole in the new cycle path and have done a terrible job making good. The tarmac is already collapsing into the ground and the join is opening up - any larger and it will eat a bike tyre and could throw the cyclist into the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Princess Elizabeth Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree roots blocking drains 3 oldbury road, 20th October
item.description:
Sorry previously submitted issue but it was closed and I have responded to your email but it now stays the email is not manned and to send here again. Hi Thank you for your response, I understand however the drain on our property is completely blocked of roots from the tree on the pavement outside the front of our home.( this is not in our control) It is my understanding that the tree falls under the highways care and that you are required to complete any maintenance work from said tree after it has been reported. I understand you have put a job on for when you have more funding but what happens untill then. I would like to know where i stand If there is damage to my property from the drains flooding due to the work not being completed as you are waiting for funding, who will then foot the bill, or do we need to pay for a private firm to remove the roots and then send across the bill to someone at highways? Please could you let me know what to do next?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Oldbury Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Possible sinkhole opening up on crossroads, 20th October
item.description:
On the crossroads between shurdington road and Moorend park road and big divot is opening up. The tarmac seems complete but itâ€™s sinking into a hole underneath - nearly through me off my bike while doing the nursery run. Very obvious if you drive over it too. Feels like a sinkhole might be forming here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73;75;77;79, Shurdington Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging tree. Tree canopy is below height of bin/delivery vehicles. Tree branches regularly fall into road/footpath (one pic shows circa 2.5m long branch moved to back of footway). Risk of injury to pedestrian and highway users and, damage to vehicles/3rd party property., 20th October
item.description:
Trees located between Hendre and Kingston Apartments along north western side of Overton Park Road. Understand land/tree owned by unknown 3rd party but obscures public highway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Overton Park Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham

item.title: Blocked drain, 20th October
item.description:
The drain on the corner, outside 21 Beverley Gardens (What3Words positive.fight.alternate) is blocked and overflows with anything heavier than a light shower. The annual maintenance team attended to all the drains in Beverley Gardens about 6 weeks ago. Their machine did not clear this blockage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beverley Gardens, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked pavement gully drain, 20th October
item.description:
The 'large' pavement gully drain between nrs 81 and 83 Cheltenham Road East GL3 1JN is blocked. The small drain on the driveway of nr 83 and the small gully drain between nrs 83 and 85 were both working well but the larger drain on the pavement was overwhelmed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
